byline.original: By MICHAEL CORKERY and JESSICA SILVER-GREENBERG

abstract: Justice Dept prosecutors and Consumer Financial Protection Bureau officials are trying to root out auto industry practice of reverse-redlining, which singles out minority borrowers and extends them costliest car loans; development could worsen economic decay in some black and Hispanic neighborhoods.
lead_paragraph: Government officials say auto sellers are singling out minority borrowers and extending them the costliest car loans, which could exacerbate some neighborhoods’ economic distress.

headline.main: Prosecutors Scrutinize Minority Borrowers’ Auto Loans

snippet: Government officials say auto sellers are singling out minority borrowers and extending them the costliest car loans, which could exacerbate some neighborhoods’ economic distress.
